entry.title: What’s this all about then?
entry.content:
What’s this all about then?

Well, in short, I’ve got some time on my hands, and a tablet (Samsung Tab S5e) with a lot of games on it. Some of them are games I play a lot, some every day, some I used to play but don’t play any more, but a bunch are games I’ve installed but never really - or actually - played. I’m going to try to get myself into a habit of reviewing one game per day(ish), in strict alphabetical order, until I get bored.

On the off-chance that I’m not bored when I run out of games, I’ve got plenty more available - quite a few on my phone which I don’t have on the tablet, and many more in my Humble Bundle account! But let’s not run before we walk, eh?

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

Jekyll requires blog post files to be named according to the following format:

YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.MARKUP

Where YEAR is a four-digit number, MONTH and DAY are both two-digit numbers, and MARKUP is the file extension representing the format used in the file. After that, include the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.
